channel.title: ATM2106 on air-sea interactions
channel.description: Recent content in ATM2106 on air-sea interactions

item.title: Homework 1
item.description: Computing the zonally averaged shortwave / longwave radiation for January and July You can find the instruction of the homework and the example from the following link: https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1ixTv-Ov1xVFpM1q0aDjO_FyhLDB6i7gd If you click the link, you may be asked to log in. Then log in Google Colaboratory with your Yonsei email. If you are comfortable with other programming languages, please feel free to use them. The data file for Matlab can be obtained from:

item.title: Homework 2
item.description: Estimating geostrophic zonal wind using thermal wind equation You can find the instruction of the homework and the example from here If you are comfortable with other programming languages, please feel free to use them. The data file for Matlab can be obtained from: data The due date is April 17th. Please send the link of your Jupyter notebook page or the pdf to TA. If there are any issues regarding the link to the Jupyter notebook file or data, please email me.

item.title: Homework 3
item.description: Computing the surface temperature trend The data shows that the warming trend is greatest near the Arctic. In this homework, we get to make a plot showing the surface temperature trend and discuss the observed trends. You can find the instruction of the homework and the example from here

item.title: Final project guide
item.description: The guide for the final project Please refer the attached pdf file in preparation of the final project. Final Project Guide final_guide.pdf (1083 ko)
